minimum_req: Desktop computer (e.g. optimized for wider screens)
Cross-platform tool (works in Windows, Mac and Linux)
output_data_formats: Widely used file formats (CSV, JSON, XML, etc.)
name: Agroforestry Map of Europe
description:
Do you manage an agroforestry system, know of or are looking for an agroforestry area, or would like to establish one?  Are you looking for a scientific institution in the field of agroforestry or contact points to find out more about the topic?  Or are you active in the upstream and downstream sectors, for example in consulting, marketing, or processing agroforestry products?
Then the Agroforestry Map of Europe is the right place for you. Trough your national Agroforrestry organisation you can register or search for agroforestry areas, service providers, actors along the entire value chain, and information and education centers or scientific institutions. You can also register if you are interested in establishing an agroforestry system. Each new entry will appear on the national maps and instantly at the Agroforestry Map of Europe at the website of EURAF, shortly after it has been successfully reviewed.

With your help, we can achieve our common goal of building the most comprehensive database on agroforestry in Europe.
developers: Deutscher Fachverband für Agroforstwirtschaft e.V. (DeFAF) – German Agroforestry Association
access_barrier: No, direct download/access through a web link
organizations: Eigen Vermogen van het Instituut voor Landbouw – En Visserijonderzoek (ILVO) – Flanders Research Institute for Agriculture, Fisheries and Food; Association pour l’agroforesterie en Wallonie et à Bruxelles (AWAF) – Association for the Promotion of Agroforestry in Wallonia and Brussels; Trakia University Bulgaria; Eidgenössisches Departement für Wirtschaft, Bildung und Forschung (WFB) – Federal Department of Economic Affairs, Education and Research; AGRIDEA; Česka Zemědělská Univerzita v Praze (CZU) – Czech University of Life Sciences Prague; Zelené poradenství s.r.o.; Copenhagen University; Regen Farmer; Universidad de Extremadura (UEx) – University of Extremadura; Forest Science Center of Catalonia (CTFC); European Agroforestry Federation (EURAF); European Forest Institute (EFI); Institut National de Recherche pour l’Agriculture, l’Alimentation et l’Environnement (INRAE) – National Research Institute for Agriculture, Nutrition and the Environment; Ελληνικό Αγροδασικό Δίκτυο (HAN) – Greek Agroforestry Network; Magyar Permakultúra Egyesület (MAPER) – Hungarian Permaculture Association; Irish Agroforestry Forum; Farm Woodland Trust; Università di Pisa (uniPI) – University of Pisa; Latvian Forest Owners' Association (LFOA); Louis Bolk Instituut (LBI), Moinhos de Vento Agroecology Research Centre (MVARC); Institute of Soil Science and Plant Cultivation, Pulawy; Research Assistant at National Institute for Research and Development in Forestry "Marin Drăcea", Romania; Sinergise Laboratorij za Geografske Informacijske Sisteme (SLGIS); Organic Research Centre (ORC), Cranfield University; University Reading
